SENT.plain: Colorectal cancer represents a major cause of cancer morbidity and mortality, with approximately 1.2 million cases and 600,000 deaths worldwide each year
Because of the anatomic continuity of the colon into the rectum, cancers affecting these organs have historically been considered equivalent
In this Prospective, we discuss the clinical and experimental data suggesting that colon cancer and rectal cancer are highly related, but distinct, diseases
Reconsidering the relationship between these cancers has implications for the development of new therapeutic paradigms
